info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 21 at 8:03PM EDT until May 21 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... The City of Franklin in southeastern Virginia... Southwestern Isle of Wight County in southeastern Virginia... Eastern Southampton County in southeastern Virginia... East central Sussex County in southeastern Virginia... South central Surry County in southeastern Virginia... * Until 845 PM EDT. * At 803 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hunterdale, or near Franklin, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Ivor around 830 PM EDT. Wakefield around 835 PM EDT. Dendron around 845 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Vicksville, Booth Fork, Lees Mill, Handsom, Berlin, Walters, Ellis Fork, Burdette, Manry and Runnymede. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
